i5.las2peer.api

Interface Context

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    L2pThread

    public interface Context
    Provides access to the context of the current call.

        Returns:

      • requestAgent

        Agent requestAgent(long agentId)
            throws AgentNotKnownException,
                   L2pSecurityException
        returns an unlocked instance of the requested Agent
        Parameters:
        agentId - the requested agent
        Returns:
        an unlocked agent instance
        Throws:
        AgentNotKnownException - agent not found
        L2pSecurityException - agent cannot be unlocked

      • getAgent

        Agent getAgent(long id)
        throws AgentNotKnownException
        Returns agents that are unlocked in this context first. E.g. necessary for opening a received Message.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        get the agent of the given id
        Throws:
        AgentNotKnownException

        Returns:
        the current context
        Throws:

      • openEnvelope

        @Deprecated
void openEnvelope(Envelope envelope)
                       throws DecodingFailedException,
                              L2pSecurityException
        Deprecated. Use Envelope.getContent() This method is stub and will be removed soon.
        Parameters:
        envelope - the Envelope to unlock
        Throws:
        DecodingFailedException
        L2pSecurityException - the MainAgent is not able to open the Envelope

      • hasAccess

        boolean hasAccess(long agentId)
           throws AgentNotKnownException,
                  AgentLockedException
        returns true if the main agent is unlocked and can unlock the given agent
        Parameters:
        agentId - an agent id
        Returns:
        true if the main agent has access to the given agent, otherwise false
        Throws:
        AgentNotKnownException - agent not found
        AgentLockedException - main agent is locked

      • invoke

        java.io.Serializable invoke(java.lang.String service,
                            java.lang.String method,
                            java.io.Serializable... parameters)
                     throws ServiceNotFoundException,
                            ServiceNotAvailableException,
                            RemoteServiceException
        Invokes the method of any other service on behalf of the main agent, thus sending the main agent as calling agent.
        Parameters:
        service - The service class. A version may be specified (for example package.serviceClass@1.0.0-1 or package.serviceClass@1.0). The core tries to find an appropriate version (version 1.0.5 matches 1.0). If no version is specified, the newest version is picked.
        method - The service method.
        parameters - The parameters list.
        Returns:
        The invocation result.
        Throws:
        ServiceNotFoundException - If the service is not known to the network.
        ServiceNotAvailableException - If the service is temporarily not available.
        RemoteServiceException - If the remote service throws an exception.

      • invokeInterally

        java.io.Serializable invokeInterally(java.lang.String service,
                                     java.lang.String method,
                                     java.io.Serializable... parameters)
                              throws ServiceNotFoundException,
                                     ServiceNotAvailableException,
                                     RemoteServiceException
        Invokes a service method using the agent of this service as calling agent.
        Parameters:
        service - The service class. A version may be specified (for example package.serviceClass@1.0.0-1 or package.serviceClass@1.0). The core tries to find an appropriate version (version 1.0.5 matches 1.0). If no version is specified, the newest version is picked.
        method - The service method.
        parameters - The parameters list.
        Returns:
        The invocation result.
        Throws:
        ServiceNotFoundException - If the service is not known to the network.
        ServiceNotAvailableException - If the service is temporarily not available.
        RemoteServiceException - If the remote service throws an exception.
